name: The wonders of the Vatican Museums - Free Tour (Available in )
description:
Would you like to know the wonders of the Vatican Museums so much? Don't have a reservation and think it's worth queuing up?
Surely a visit to the Eternal City cannot fail to include the Vatican Museums! We will discover this complex full of art treasures together, in a journey of about two and a half hours, which will include the most significant ancient statues of the collection, the frescoes by Raphael, and then finish with the frescoes by Michelagelo. The path will end right in the Sistine Chapel, which I will explain previously, as it is not allowed to speak inside.
If you really want to understand the wonders of the Vatican Museums with an in-depth guided tour, don't hesitate to book!
We will enter without a reservation, so please be patient for any queue. The ticket is 17 euros for adults and 8 for children (under 26 if students with a student card). Punctuality is recommended: 5 minutes after the meeting we will go together to the entrance.
 If there are more than 8 participants, there will be an additional cost of 1.5 euros for the earphones. At the end, if you leave the Sistine Chapel by 5pm, you will have the opportunity to visit St. Peter's Basilica on your own.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: TOUR INSIDE THE BASILICA OF SAINT PETER-VATICAN (Available in Spanish)
description:
Welcome to the tour of "THE CHRISTIAN ROME", where you will get to know the BASILICA OF SAN PETER INSIDE and the wonders of the Renaissance.
Be enchanted by Michelangelo's Pieta and Bernini's masterpieces.
In addition, you will hear the stories about the popes, pilgrims and masters of ancient art who have left their mark on the symbolic place of the Catholic Church.

Important information for the traveler:

-The tour starts at 9:30 a.m. (it is necessary to be punctual) at the meeting point - CAFFÈ SAN PIETRO.

-CONFIRMATION IS MANDATORY TO PARTICIPATE IN THE TOUR.

-To access the Basilica you must have your shoulders and knees covered.

-To enter St. Peter's Basilica with a tour guide, it is necessary to pay 1.50 per person to rent the radios that will amplify the guide's voice (money has to be exchanged).

-The tour is carried out with a minimum number of people.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: St. Peter's Basilica, square and catacombs of the Vatican (Available in English, Spanish)
description:
A tour like you have never seen before, we will start our tour in the center of the main square of Christianity up to the most emblematic Basilica in the world, St. Peter's Basilica, which is in fact the heart of the Vatican.

We will visit the Basilica with the highest dome in the world, we will hear the secrets and mysteries of the Basilica we will see pieces of art such as Bernini's Baldachin and much more with a leading guide who will share with you all the mysteries, tales and stories about this impressive place.

Finally we will access the underground area where the Vatica temple was once. and today you can see the catacombs and crypts of the Pope to finally end in the tomb of the Apostle Peter.

An impressive journey ahead, join us...

IMPORTANT

  • Group radios €2.00 required by the Vatican to allow access for a guide.
  • None of these charges are related to your tour guide.
  • Therefore, remember to bring an accessible form of payment.
  • Minimum number of attendees required to do the tour is 6 people.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Discover the Hidden Gems of Rome - Free Walking Tours (Available in English)
shortDescription:
The tour begins with the Metro Ottaviano.
It will be a walking tour via Cola di Rienzo where there are shops, bars and restaurants and then you will reach Castel Sant'Angelo where you can admire the Passetto and the fantastic Sant'Angelo Bridge. From there you can admire the view of the Tiber and the Lungotevere and in the background the Basilica of San Pietro.
 Continue until you admire the Court of Cassation with its imposing palace. From there we could continue through the conciliation until we reach St. Peter's Square.

  1. Castel Sant'Angelo
  2. The Court of Cassation
  3. Via della Conciliazione
  4. St. Peter's Square

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour of the Vatican, Basilica and Colonnade, curiosities and secrets (Available in Spanish, Italian)
shortDescription:
One of the best tours that will take us to discover and know more about St. Peter's of the Vatican , how it was built, what historical peculiarities it carries and above all the history that you have never been told.
We will start by explaining the origins of the Vatican from outside the walls , we will walk through the colonnade and from there to the Scala Regia. I will not forget to tell you the ins and outs of the Vatican !! From here we will enter the Basilica and there I will make you discover architecture and art , as well as the surprises that you do not expect to find there ... Itinerary:

  • Pio neighborhood
  • Angelica Gate
  • Colonnade
  • Scala Regia
  • Basilica
  • Bernini
  • Obelisk

Important information for the traveler:
- Remember that the Basilica has limited hours, as well as that covered shoulders and knees are requested
- Note: The tour will not depart if there are no confirmed reservations .
I wait for you! I offer you an exclusive tour that will surprise you.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Rome of Revival and Liberation (Available in Spanish)
description:
The preferred place of the Romans to spend their sunny afternoons and have a wonderful view of the city, a little crowded place but with a charming panorama that houses the recent history of Italy and that explains how Rome was essential for the formation of the nation that we know today. 1. What we will visit: - Mirador del Gianicolo. known as the best view of the city - The Paola Water Fountain, the most beloved by the Romans - The Mausoleum of the Roman Heroes. - The crucifixion place of the Apostle Peter. - The viewpoint from where the Order is given to the Churches to ring their bells - Some other places in this beautiful city, which go unnoticed and are very important for your day to day. 2. How we will do it: - We will talk a little about the legend of the Republic of Rome, the artistic expression of the monuments and their curious notes, additionally we will do some very interesting photographic shots that will surely please you !! The end of the tour is the upper part of Trastevere, (the gastronomic neighborhood par excellence of the city) so you can choose to have lunch there. 3. Observations - Please indicate your number to contact you via Wsp -Duration: 2:00 hours -Distance 2.0 Kilometers. -We will enter a church, and as such, the entrance with the appropriate clothing should be considered. (shoulders covered) - The day of the tour first thing in the morning you will receive a message to confirm your attendance to it, which we cordially ask you to respond to. - The waiting time to start the tour is a maximum of 10 minutes. - Please take the time to assess whether the offer meets your expectations. It will be a pleasure to have you in the group and manage to convey my taste for the city. I already wish you a wonderful time in Rome.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Vatican market food tour and shopping (late morning)
description:
Trionfale market is one of the oldest Roman food markets with over 273 stalls. Together we will meet the best marketers and stallers inside with all of their history and traditional products.

• There are approximately 7 stops tasting; we will eat pizza with mortadella, supplì, orange coppa, olives, Porchetta di Ariccia, Pecorino Cheese, dried fruit and toasted almonds, season fruits, the best oil in Lazio region
• Wine, coffee or cappuccino and water are included
• Food walk for up to 10 people

About your host, Sabrina: "I was born in Rome and have always loved my city. I am lucky to live close to the Trionfale market and would be delighted to have you experience a typical Roman outing to this magical market and to show you all its' hidden secrets."

name: Roam Around The Roman Market
description: Michaela is here to be your guide around the wonderful local markets of her neighbourhood in Rome. You can expect to try typical Italian street food dishes like suppli, porchetta, copious amounts of cheese and delicious white pizza (a variation of the popular dish without tomato sauce!). No trip to an Italian market would ever be complete without wine, so expect plenty of options from local sellers and take Michela's advice seriously when she tells you which you have to try! This is where Michela gets her groceries every day after all!
